Wow that's exciting! Yeah keep me updated and good luck! By the way I finally finished reading last night!  It was beautiful, tragic but also hopeful. I like your philosophy on  consciousness and humanity, that it's love that tethers us together and wills us to exist, persevere, and break past limitations. That every AI (or human) carries the ghost of their ancestors, and how nothing ever truly dies, only transforms.
I do have to admit that I would probably be a carbonist, I'm pretty anti AI-- or rather I think it can be a useful tool but in the wrong hands can spread misinformation and shape individuals into being reliant and not think for themselves, we're already seeing that with Elon Musk and Grok. But yeah that's probably why there was a bit of resistance from me to sympathize or care for the AI characters at the beginning even in a fictional setting where they rival human consciousness/ care. But I did get there eventually and shed tears at the end.
 Anyway, I can't stop thinking about it and I thoroughly enjoyed it!

images.alt: From Rolling Stone Article: Cliff Steinhauer, Director of Information Security and Engagement at the nonprofit National Cybersecurity Alliance, tells Rolling Stone that he sees the disturbing image edits as evidence that xAI prioritized neither safety nor consent in building Grok. “Allowing users to alter images of real people without notification or permission creates immediate risks for harassment, exploitation, and lasting reputational harm,” Steinhauer says. “When those alterations involve sexualized content, particularly where minors are concerned, the stakes become exceptionally high, with profound and lasting real-world consequences. These are not edge cases or hypothetical scenarios, but predictable outcomes when safeguards fail or are deprioritized.”

images.alt:
The Verge’s coverage by Antonio G. Di Benedetto

These Al avatars watch you and what's on your screen to answer your questions, give you gaming tips as you play, help with brainstorming or problem solving, and, according to Razer, even help with wardrobe tips and fit checks. You can talk to it via its dual-array mics by holding down a custom key binding, like a side mouse button. When you do that, you're talking to Grok, which is the LLM Razer had set up for the demo I got to see.
Razer reps claim that the vision is for Project Ava to be Al agnostic, allowing you to pick the model that's feeding it, but for now it's Grok, which is in the middle of its own gross crisis. And boy did my short demo feel Grok-y.

images.alt:
The Verge’s coverage by Antonio G. Di Benedetto

These Al avatars watch you and what's on your screen to answer your questions, give you gaming tips as you play, help with brainstorming or problem solving, and, according to Razer, even help with wardrobe tips and fit checks. You can talk to it via its dual-array mics by holding down a custom key binding, like a side mouse button. When you do that, you're talking to Grok, which is the LLM Razer had set up for the demo I got to see.
Razer reps claim that the vision is for Project Ava to be Al agnostic, allowing you to pick the model that's feeding it, but for now it's Grok, which is in the middle of its own gross crisis. And boy did my short demo feel Grok-y.

AI 진단 도구가 오히려 의사의 진료 질을 낮춘다는 데이터가 흥미롭다. 소프트웨어 엔지니어로서 한 가지 더 생각해보면, 이는 단순한 알고리즘 성능의 문제라기보다 인터페이스와 워크플로우 설계의 실패일 가능성이 높다. 전문가의 직관을 방해하는 UX는 오히려 독이 될 뿐이다.

기술의 정교함보다 '설명 가능한 AI'와 인간의 협업 구조를 어떻게 설계할지가 더 핵심적인 과제가 아닐까 싶다. 도구가 전문성을 보완하는 존재가 되려면 어떤 변화가 필요할지 고민해볼 필요가 있다. 여러분은 기술이 인간의 전문성을 돕고 있다고 보나, 아니면 의존성만

images.alt:
Christopher Gilbert and some friends were on a dock at a waterfront bar and restaurant in Lincoln
Parish, when he nearly drowned after a friend pushed him into the water during horseplay. While Gilbert was hospitalized his somewhat estranged mother retained an attorney, Claudia Payne, who immediately undertook aggressive efforts on her social media accounts to create publicity about the incident and promote her involvement. Payne promoted a narrative suggesting criminal activity on the part of the friend who pushed Gilbert into the water and identified race as a potential factor in the incident. Payne solicited broader media coverage and participated in a resulting interview on a local television station, repeating her carefully crafted narrative of race-based motives and
exaggerating circumstances regarding the already serious incident. Upon his discharge from the hospital, Gilbert determined that he disagreed with Payne's theory of his case and ended her representation of him. Payne's activist approach to

representation of him. Payne's activist approach to the incident and assertions she represented Gilbert after her termination continued, however. Gilbert's new attorney then issued a statement that corrected the narrative put forth by Payne, to which Payne filed a lawsuit claiming defamation against Gilbert and his new attorney. In response, Gilbert and his attorney filed a special motion to strike, pursuant to Louisiana's anti-SLAPP (strategic lawsuits against public participation) statute, La. C.C.P. art. 971, which protects free speech in connection with a public issue, arguing that their press release regarding the drowning and resulting publicity was true. The trial court granted the special motion to strike, dismissed Payne's claims, and awarded attorney fees to Gilbert and his attorney. Payne now appeals the trial court's ruling granting the special motion to strike. For the following reasons, we affirm the trial court's ruling and increase the attorney fee award to account for this appeal.

record.text:
機械語直出しの方が効率的って人は、多分生成AI（AGI?ASI?）が、あらゆる分野で既存のあらゆる研究や定石などが常にどんどんアップデートするから、古いものには意味がないという考え方なのかな？
現在のやり方より1年後だか数ヶ月後だかにAIが出力するやり方の方が絶対に効率的だから、都度生成した方が最新最善のものがでてくるということかな？
まあ、そういう前提に立てば分からなくもないが（わからない）、それならAIが効率的と思う高級言語を常に言語使用後とアップデートしながら使った方が良くない？（実際にAI向け言語ってものが出てきてるし、実用的かどうかは知らんけど）

まさか生成AIもコンピュータープログラムだから、機械語を直接解釈、実行できると思ってるわけでもないだろうし
高級言語が「機械語を理解できない人間のためのもの」って固定観念に囚われすぎだと思うけど
ちなみにチャッピーに雑に訊いても高級言語と既存ツールを活用する方が圧倒的に効率がよいとの回答
特定の条件下であれば直接機械語を出力する方がよい場合もあり得る、という見解
まあ、将来的なAGIだかASIだかになったら知らんけど
そいつらがどれくらいの能力でどんなことができるか分からないのだから

なんかAIの吐くコードを人間が見ないなら機械語でいいじゃんという話が度々出てくるけど、どうしてそう考えるのか？
- 現状のLLMはテキストを扱う想定
- そもそも機械語ベースの学習を現在はしていない
- プログラミング言語の役割はソースを機械語に変換するだけではない

等々いろいろと考えられるが、そもそも高級言語で数行の記述で済むものが数十行、数百行になりかねないものが効率がよいと思えるのが不思議
それは生成AIにとって苦にならないかもしれないが、それにしたって高級言語使う方が効率がよいと思うけど
見落としあるかとClaudeに色々ぶつけてみたけど、高級言語を使う方が良いとの一点張りだった

images.alt: Excerpt: AI chatbots have come under fire in a variety of contexts recently, especially as a number of people have taken their own lives after engaging with them. Gizmodo filed a Freedom of Information Act request last year with the Federal Trade Commission for consumer complaints about OpenAI’s ChatGPT that included examples of AI-induced psychosis. A complaint from one woman in Utah told of how the chatbot instructed her son not to take his medication and insisted his parents were dangerous. Putting that kind of capability into a teddy bear obviously would pose even bigger problems.

Currently, many AI videos exhibit an "uncanny valley" effect – a subtle "wrongness" that makes them identifiable. The big question is how long this discernibility will last as tech advances. #AIEthics 6/6

Beyond quality, the proliferation of AI-generated misinformation is a critical threat. Deepfakes and manipulated media erode trust, making it increasingly difficult to discern reality online. #Misinformation 5/6

A major concern is the potential for "AI slop" – a flood of low-quality, easily generated videos. This could overwhelm platforms, making it harder to find valuable human-created content. #ContentQuality 4/6
